channel.title: Compile error
channel.description:
Ok, when I run my client sided compiler it says
Stream.java:6: package sign does not exist import sign.signlink; ^
(^ First error btw) with
98 errors Press any key to continue . . .
But yet when I upload this same folder and have my friend download it, he gets zero errors and his compiler works fine... Any suggestions on how to fix??

item.title: Compile error
item.dc:creator: @I96 I96
item.description:
@I96 wrote:

I’ve gotten this problem before and idk what caused it but what fixed it for me wus i changed the compiler, try this: @echo off Title Compiler COLOR 0a "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause
Change the 24 to your version of jdk but i changed my compiler to that and it worked for me so give that a try.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

yes i know, i realized that, i checked the spelling and for capitals, nothing worked… and did you not read the posts before this? when i uploaded this client and my friend downloaded it, then compiled with no errors?

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

If you read it, it’s saying there’s no signlink.java

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

yea, turtle, i even downloaded a different client and got the same errors lol

Read full topic

item.title: Compile error
item.dc:creator: @Racist_Turtle Racist Turtle
item.description:
@Racist_Turtle wrote:

Try re-downloading the client. The error is basically saying that the package “sign” isn’t there, and any classes of that package wouldn’t be there either. So something must have went wrong in the downloading process. When you say however that when it works for you friend, I’m lost there.

Read full topic
